title_narrative: UKAM: New technology to accelerate landmine removal for Zimbabwe's rural poor October 2020 to September 2021
sector_narrative: This project aims to safe lives and increase livelihoods in Zimbabwe by: 1) clearing landmines, and 2) providing risk education
This project aims to safe lives and increase livelihoods in Zimbabwe by: 1) clearing landmines, and 2) providing risk education
description_narrative: This project aims to safe lives and increase livelihoods in Zimbabwe by: 1) clearing landmines, and 2) providing risk education

This project has two primary objectives: 1) Remove the threat landmines pose to 1200 people living in border communities, allowing access to safe land and community infrastructure for these and a further 2250 people indirectly and 2) Contribute to the Mine Action sector by conducting full field-testing of new demining equipment that has the potential to increaseclearance rates and increase human safety across the world.
The Target group for this project is 1200 people living in border communities that have settledalong these roads directly opposite minefields.
